item.title: Bee add a quote by Jeff Snyder (Nation of Cowards)
item.description: "And if we think that laws designed to prevent crime can indeed make the world a safer place, we should ask ourselves this: How exactly, is the world made a safer place by making self-control and responsibility irrelevant?" -- Jeff Snyder (Nation of Cowards)

item.title: Bee add a quote by Thomas Paine
item.description: "A long habit of not thinking a thing wrong, gives it a superficial appearance of being right, and raises at first a formidable outcry in defense of custom. But the tumult soon subsides. Time makes more converts than reason." -- Thomas Paine

item.title: Bee add a quote by Toni Morrison
item.description: "O Jesus, I could be a mule or plow the furrows with my hands if need be or hold those rickety walls up with my back if need be if I knew that somewhere in this world in the pocket of some night I could open my legs to some cowboy lean hips but you are trying to tell me no and O my sweet Jesus what kind of cross is that?" -- Toni Morrison

item.title: Bee add a quote by Pam Munoz Ryan
item.description: "Esperanza leaned around the side of the truck. As they rounded a curve, it appeared as if the mountains pulled away from each other, like a curtain opening on stage, revealing the San Joaquin Valley beyond. Flat and spacious, it spread out like a blanket of patchwork fields. Esperanza could see no end to the plots of yellow, brown, and shades of green. The road finally leveled out on the valley floor, and she gazed back at the mountains from where they'd come. They looked like monstrous lions' paws resting at the edge of ridge. " -- Pam Munoz Ryan

item.title: Bee add a quote by Henry Miller
item.description: "Let me be, was all I wanted. Be what I am, no matter how I am." -- Henry Miller

item.title: Bee add a quote by Henry Miller
item.description: "Everyone has his own reality in which, if one is not too cautious, timid or frightened, one swims. This is the only reality there is." -- Henry Miller

item.title: Bee add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "We write to taste life twice, in the moment and in retrospect." -- Anais Nin

item.title: Bee add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "Life shrinks or expands in proportion to one's courage." -- Anais Nin

item.title: Bee add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "What can I do with my happiness? How can I keep it, conceal it, bury it where I may never lose it? I want to kneel as it falls over me like rain, gather it up with lace and silk, and press it over myself again." -- Anais Nin

item.title: Bee add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "The single biggest problem in communication is the illusion that it has taken place." -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Bee add a quote by Anaïs Nin
item.description: "People living deeply have no fear of death." -- Anaïs Nin

item.title: Bee add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "The role of a writer is not to say what we can all say, but what we are unable to say." -- Anais Nin

item.title: Bee add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "Bees do have a smell, you know, and if they don't they should, for their feet are dusted with spices from a million flowers." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Bee add a quote by Margaret Carty
item.description: "The nice thing about teamwork is that you always have others on your side." -- Margaret Carty
